meanings.definition: To remove or uproot from a place or position.
meanings.sent1: The gardener carefully displants the flowers to a new location.
meanings.sent2: The storm displants many trees from the ground.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel displants all the acorns from the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected resignation displants the team dynamics.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind displants the sand dunes along the beach.

meanings.definition: To displace or remove from a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The revolution displants the oppressive regime from ruling the country.
meanings.sent2: The board decision displants the CEO from his position.
meanings.sent3: The magic trick displants the king from his throne for a moment.
meanings.sent4: The scandal displants the politician from his high status.
meanings.sent5: The new law displants the old regulations from governing the industry.
